amendment.description: Amendment sought to limit any funding by the Comptroller of the Currency to implement rulemaking permitting national banks, or operating subsidiaries of national banks, to engage in activities in which national banks are not permitted to engage, as of July 16, 1996.
amendment.purpose: An amendment to deny use of funds appropriated in the bill for certain transactions conducted by the Comptroller of Currency.

action.text: Mr. Hoyer raised a point of order against the Solomon amendment (A009). Mr. Hoyer stated that the provisions of the amendment constituted legislation on an appropriations bill and as such were in violation of the Rules of the House. Debate ensued on the point of order. Point of order overruled by the Chair.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Solomon amendment (A009) Failed by recorded vote: 107 - 312, 4 Present (Roll no. 321).
